alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 10:55PM CST until January 24 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, Caddo and De Soto and northeast Texas, including the following counties, Angelina, Cherokee, Gregg, Harrison, Nacogdoches, Panola, Rusk, San Augustine, Shelby and Smith. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Nacogdoches, Jacksonville, Henderson, Carthage, Rusk, Center, Hudson, Stonewall, Logansport, Tatum, Alto, Tenaha, Timpson, New London, Garrison, Beckville, Joaquin, Wells and Minden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
